metadata.title: CVE-2024-31948 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In FRRouting (FRR) through 9.1, an attacker using a malformed Prefix SIDattribute in a BGP UPDATE packet can cause the bgpd daemon to crash.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-31948` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

frr - 8.1-1ubuntu1.10
frr-pythontools - 8.1-1ubuntu1.10
frr-rpki-rtrlib - 8.1-1ubuntu1.10
frr-snmp - 8.1-1ubuntu1.10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: frr package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.1-1ubuntu1.10').
